verses.kjv: Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the room of his father Amaziah.
verses.ct: Then all the people of Judah chose Uzziah, who was 16 years old, and crowned him king to succeed his father Amaziah.

verses.kjv: He built Eloth, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.
verses.ct: He rebuilt Eloth and brought it back under Judah's control after his father had died.

verses.kjv: Sixteen years old was Uzziah when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty and two years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name also was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Uzziah was 16 when he became king, and he ruled for 52 years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jecoliah, from Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father Amaziah did.
verses.ct: He did what was right in the LORD's sight, just as his father Amaziah had done.

verses.kjv: And he sought God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the visions of God: and as long as he sought the LORD, God made him to prosper.
verses.ct: He devoted himself to seeking God during the lifetime of Zechariah, who had insight into the visions of God. As long as he pursued the LORD, God gave him success.

verses.kjv: And he went forth and warred against the Philistines, and brake down the wall of Gath, and the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod, and built cities about Ashdod, and among the Philistines.
verses.ct: He marched out and waged war against the Philistines, tearing down the walls of Gath, Jabneh, and Ashdod. He also constructed towns in the territory around Ashdod and throughout Philistine land.

verses.kjv: And God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabians that dwelt in Gurbaal, and the Mehunims.
verses.ct: God gave him victory over the Philistines, the Arabians living in Gurbaal, and the Mehunims.

verses.kjv: And the Ammonites gave gifts to Uzziah: and his name spread abroad even to the entering in of Egypt; for he strengthened himself exceedingly.
verses.ct: The Ammonites paid tribute to Uzziah, and his reputation spread all the way to the border of Egypt, because he had become extremely powerful.

verses.kjv: Moreover Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate, and at the valley gate, and at the turning of the wall, and fortified them.
verses.ct: Uzziah also constructed towers in Jerusalem at the Corner Gate, the Valley Gate, and the angle of the wall, and he reinforced them.

verses.kjv: Also he built towers in the desert, and digged many wells: for he had much cattle, both in the low country, and in the plains: husbandmen also, and vine dressers in the mountains, and in Carmel: for he loved husbandry.
verses.ct: He built towers in the wilderness too, and dug many cisterns, because he owned large herds in the foothills and on the plains. He also had farmers and vineyard workers in the hill country and in the fertile lands, because he had a passion for agriculture.

verses.kjv: Moreover Uzziah had an host of fighting men, that went out to war by bands, according to the number of their account by the hand of Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the ruler, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king’s captains.
verses.ct: Uzziah maintained an army of trained soldiers organized into units, counted and recorded by Jeiel the secretary and Maaseiah the officer, under the command of Hananiah, one of the king's commanders.

verses.kjv: The whole number of the chief of the fathers of the mighty men of valour were two thousand and six hundred.
verses.ct: The total number of family leaders over these elite warriors was 2,600.

verses.kjv: And under their hand was an army, three hundred thousand and seven thousand and five hundred, that made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.
verses.ct: Under their command was a fighting force of 307,500 soldiers who could wage war with great skill to support the king against any enemy.

verses.kjv: And Uzziah prepared for them throughout all the host shields, and spears, and helmets, and habergeons, and bows, and slings to cast stones.
verses.ct: Uzziah equipped the entire army with shields, spears, helmets, body armor, bows, and stones for slinging.

verses.kjv: And he made in Jerusalem engines, invented by cunning men, to be on the towers and upon the bulwarks, to shoot arrows and great stones withal. And his name spread far abroad; for he was marvellously helped, till he was strong.
verses.ct: In Jerusalem he installed machines designed by skilled engineers on the towers and corner fortifications to launch arrows and large stones. His fame spread far and wide, because he received remarkable help until he became very powerful.

verses.kjv: But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up to his destruction: for he transgressed against the LORD his God, and went into the temple of the LORD to burn incense upon the altar of incense.
verses.ct: But once he became powerful, his pride led to his downfall. He sinned against the LORD his God by entering the LORD's temple to burn incense on the incense altar.

verses.kjv: And Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him fourscore priests of the LORD, that were valiant men:
verses.ct: Azariah the priest followed him in, along with 80 courageous priests of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And they withstood Uzziah the king, and said unto him, It appertaineth not unto thee, Uzziah, to burn incense unto the LORD, but to the priests the sons of Aaron, that are consecrated to burn incense: go out of the sanctuary; for thou hast trespassed; neither shall it be for thine honour from the LORD God.
verses.ct: They confronted King Uzziah and told him, "It is not your place, Uzziah, to burn incense to the LORD. That responsibility belongs only to the priests, the descendants of Aaron, who have been set apart for this duty. Leave the sanctuary! You have violated God's law, and the Lord GOD will not honor you for this."

verses.kjv: Then Uzziah was wroth, and had a censer in his hand to burn incense: and while he was wroth with the priests, the leprosy even rose up in his forehead before the priests in the house of the LORD, from beside the incense altar.
verses.ct: Uzziah became furious. He was holding a censer ready to burn incense, and while he raged at the priests, a skin disease suddenly broke out on his forehead right there in front of the priests in the LORD's temple, next to the incense altar.

verses.kjv: And Azariah the chief priest, and all the priests, looked upon him, and, behold, he was leprous in his forehead, and they thrust him out from thence; yea, himself hasted also to go out, because the LORD had smitten him.
verses.ct: When Azariah the chief priest and all the other priests turned to look at him, they saw the disease on his forehead. They rushed him out of there, and he himself hurried to leave, because the LORD had struck him.

verses.kjv: And Uzziah the king was a leper unto the day of his death, and dwelt in a several house, being a leper; for he was cut off from the house of the LORD: and Jotham his son was over the king’s house, judging the people of the land.
verses.ct: King Uzziah suffered from that skin disease for the rest of his life. He lived in a separate house, quarantined, because he was banned from the LORD's temple. His son Jotham took charge of the royal palace and governed the people of the land.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, did Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, write.
verses.ct: The rest of what Uzziah did, from beginning to end, was recorded by the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.

verses.kjv: So Uzziah slept with his fathers, and they buried him with his fathers in the field of the burial which belonged to the kings; for they said, He is a leper: and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Uzziah died and joined his ancestors. They buried him near his ancestors in a field next to the royal burial ground, because people said, "He had a skin disease." His son Jotham became king after him.
